The mobile page to write to.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the specified class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Adapters are usually constructed automatically by ASP.NET, and must have a default constructor.

Docs.summary: Adds a variable to be initialized when the browser renders the form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks All references to the client identifier on the page are mapped, resulting in the same postback regardless of mapping. The AddFormVariable method also can scramble client IDs that must be encrypted for security reasons. Only visible controls generate variables.

.property instance bool AnalyzeMode

Docs.summary: Sets or returns whether the writer is in analyze mode. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: if the writer is in analyze mode; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks WML rendering is done in two phases. In the first phase, all calls to the renderer are analyzed for correctness. In the second phase, the rendering is performed.

MemberSignature.Value: protected string MapClientIDToShortName (string clientID, bool generateRandomID);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig instance string MapClientIDToShortName(string clientID, bool generateRandomID) cil managed

Docs.param: The client ID of a control to map.
Determines whether the client ID is encrypted.
Docs.summary: Maps the client ID of a control to a short name to be used in rendering on the form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: A string representation of the client identifier of the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the client identifier of a control is longer than 16 characters, ASP.NET substitutes a uniquely mapped short name.
All references to the client identifier on the page are mapped, resulting in the same postback regardless of mapping. MapClientIDToShortName can also scramble client IDs that must be encrypted for security reasons.

MemberSignature.Value: protected int NumberOfSoftkeys { get; }
.property instance int32 NumberOfSoftkeys

Docs.summary: Returns the number of softkeys supported on the device. The default value is 0. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The number of softkeys supported on the device.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Softkeys are special keys that the application can usually map to custom tasks. Softkey text is displayed on the screen in the lower-left and lower-right corners.

The softkey text to use for the link if the `mapToSoftKey` parameter is set to .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void RenderBeginSelect (string name, string iname, string ivalue, string title, bool multiSelect);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RenderBeginSelect(string name, string iname, string ivalue, string title, bool multiSelect) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the control.
The name that the browser must use to submit the selected index back to the server.
The initial value.
The attribute on WML devices.
Whether to allow multiple selections.
Docs.summary: Begins rendering a selection list. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Either `name` or `iname` must be non-null.
This method can be followed by calls to the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.RenderSelectOption%2A> method for each option, followed by a call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.RenderEndSelect%2A> method to end the selection list.

MemberSignature.Value: protected void RenderDoEvent (string doType, string target, string arg, System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPostFieldType postBackType, string text, bool includeVariables);

.method familyhidebysig instance void RenderDoEvent(string doType, string target, string arg, valuetype System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPostFieldType postBackType, string text, bool includeVariables) cil managed

Docs.param: The type of action to render. Maps to the type attribute of the element. Usually "accept" or "options".
The ID of the control targeted by the action. When the user selects the action, a postback is generated, targeting the control specified by this ID.
The argument for the action. The argument is included in the postback generated when the user selects the action.
The type used for `arg.`
The label associated with the action. This usually appears as a softkey label on the device.
Whether to include all variables on the form when posting back to the server.
Docs.summary: Renders a event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the control you are targeting is the current form and you want to include all the variables when posting back to the server, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.RenderFormDoEvent%2A> method. Called internally by the writer and inherited classes.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RenderTextBox(string id, string value, string format, string title, bool password, int32 size, int32 maxLength, bool generateRandomID, bool breakAfter) cil managed

Docs.param: Identifies the control.
Specifies the initial value of the text box.
Specifies an optional WML format string.
Contains the title of the text box.
Specifies the password.
Sets the size of the string.
Specifies the maximum length of the string.
Determines whether the identifier for the control (ID) is encrypted.
Set to if a break is required after the control is rendered.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method can also scramble client IDs that must be encrypted for security reasons.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method closes all character formatting tags, such as `< b >`, that have been opened.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Encoding involves mapping characters with HTML/WML meanings to the appropriate character code.
